snippet.title: Everything we know about the iPhone 8
snippet.content:
Media reports and analysts say that Apple will launch an iPhone this year with a edge-to-edge screen and no home button.
Apple seemingly confirmed this rumour with a picture included in recently released software.
Apple has launched a new iPhone in September for the last five years.
Apple is widely expected to launch new iPhones in September.
There's been a ton of speculation and reports about the upcoming iPhone, which is expected to be completely redesigned.
The pressure is on Apple, too. It's the 10th anniversary of the first-ever iPhone, launched in 2007, and the company is expected to have some big plans to mark the occasion.
Wall Street analysts hope the new iPhone drives a "" of sales, propelling Apple to become the first trillion-dollar publicly-traded company.
Apple rarely comments on upcoming products, but some accidentally-released code from Apple suggests some of the rumours may be accurate.
Here's what you need to know about the upcoming iPhone.
ong>
